info.name: bender-error
info.description:
# Flight Landers Back End Server
**Bender** is the back end server for FLanders, a flight search engine set up during our 
## Estructure
- **Public**:
Login and search engine.
- **Authorized**:
Update profile and book flights.

request.description:
# Register Random User
This will register a new random user in the system.
Will also send a mail to the user mail.
In this case we are using a free public inbox:
randomUserName@mailinator.com
You can check it out or try with your own mail.

Mail is unique ID in the system.

If you run this routes in order with a test script this route post test script will store the registered mail as env variable.
this variable is used in the route login aswell.


Once a mail is deleted it can never be use again in that DB.

response.name: /signin (randomUser)

exec: pm.test("That mail is already in use", function () {
pm.expect(jsonData.details).to.eql("Ese mail ya está en uso");

request.description:
# This Route Tests what happens if mail has been registered
This will try to register again the same user that the last route used.

Mail is unique ID in the system.

response.name: /signin  (Mail in use)

request.description:
# This Route Tests what happens there is a validation error
This will try to register with some empty fields.

response.name: /signin  (Bad request)

request.description:
# This Route Tests the Joi .ref() bug.
Joi.ref(...).required is not a function so this field could be empty and store a new password without ref check.

# Tests a Validation error at login
Will send an incomplete form.

response.name: /login (Validation Error)

request.description:
# Invalid Credentials Test
Will send Invalid credentials.

response.name: /login (Invalid credentiala)

request.description:
# POST Login
This route will log an user in the sistem and receive a token as well.
In this case it will use the last user stored on env.

This will store the token ok the env.

response.name: /login

request.description:
# This Route Tests the Joi .ref() bug.
Joi.ref(...).required is not a function so this field could be empty and store a new password without ref check.

# Invalid old password.
Tries to change the password without knowinf the last valid password.

response.name: /update/pass (Invalid old password)

exec: pm.test("Its a repeat password error", function () {

exec: pm.expect(pm.response.text()).to.include("Acceso denegado, proporciona credenciales válidas por favor");

request.description:
# DELETE?
Due to data consistency we cant currently delete the user, instead we make unavaible FOREVER.
That mail can never be used again in the system and user will be redirected to the login page.

response.name: /update/delete (No token)

request.description:
# DELETE?
Due to data consistency we cant currently delete the user, instead we make unavaible FOREVER.
That mail can never be used again in the system and user will be redirected to the login page.

response.name: /update/delete (Invalid token)
response.body:
{
    "name": "JsonWebTokenError",
    "message": "jwt malformed",
    "code": 401,
    "details": "Access denied. Please, log in with valid credentials.",
    "ok": false
}

request.description:
# Make a Flight Search
This route answers the question "What Flights are there from X to Y in that date por Z persons?"

response.name: /search/flight (Invalid Date)

request.description:
# Try to time travel
Tries to search a date return before departure date

response.name: /search/flight (Return before going)

# Too many Adults
Amadeus limits the searching up to 9 adults.
